doc:
Lee White (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee_White_(actor) 0 Lee White (August 28, 1888 – December 16, 1949), better known as Lee "Lasses" White, was an American actor of the stage, screen and radio. He became famous doing minstrel shows during the early part of the 1900s, during which time he earned his nickname of "Lasses", which was short for Molasses. After spending some time on radio, White entered the film industry in the late 1930s. During his eleven-year career he appeared in over 70 films. Lee_White ( August_28_,_1888 – December_16_,_1949 ) , better_known as Lee_"_Lasses_"_White , was an_American_actor of the_stage_,_screen_and_radio . He became famous_doing_minstrel_shows during the_early_part of the_1900s , during which time he earned his_nickname of " Lasses " , which was short for Molasses . After spending some_time on radio , White entered the_film_industry in the_late_1930s . During his_eleven-year_career he appeared in over_70_films .
